017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link DeterministicSupplier} with additional contractual
037 * requirements.
038 *
039 * <p><strong>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an
040 * {@link Optional} or a {@link
041 * java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},</strong> despite the
042 * deliberate similarities of some method names.</p>
043 *
044 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
045 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
046 * class</a>.</p>
047 *
048 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
049 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
050 *
051 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
052 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
053 *
054 * @see #presence()
055 *
056 * @see #deterministic()
057 *
058 * @see #get()
059 *
060 * @see #optional()
061 */
062@FunctionalInterface
063public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends DeterministicSupplier<T> {
064
065  /**
066   * Invokes the {@link #presence()} method and invokes {@link
067   * Presence#deterministic() deterministic()} on its return value and
068   * returns the result.
069   *
070   * <p>Overrides of this method are <strong>strongly</strong>
071   * discouraged.</p>
072   *
073   * <p>Any (discouraged) overriding of this method should be
074   * undertaken with a sensible override of the {@link #presence()}
075   * method as well.</p>
076   *
077   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link OptionalSupplier}
078   * is known to be deterministic
079   *
080   * @idempotency This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides must
081   * be, idempotent and deterministic.
082   *
083   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
084   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
085   *
086   * @see #presence()
087   *
088   * @see DeterministicSupplier#deterministic()
089   */
090  @Override // DeterministicSupplier<T>
091  @OverridingDiscouraged
092  public default boolean deterministic() {
093    return this.presence().deterministic();
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
098   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
099   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
100   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
101   * that does occur, including {@link NoSuchElementException} and
102   * {@link UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
103   * indicate value absence.
104   *
105   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
106   *
107   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
108   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
109   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method
110   * on the supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException}
111   * that does occur
112   *
113   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
114   * null}
115   *
116   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
117   * return {@code null}
118   *
119   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
120   * determinism.
121   *
122   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
123   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads,
124   * but the {@link Function#apply(Object) apply(Object)} method of
125   * the supplied {@code handler} may not be.
126   *
127   * @see #get()
128   */
129  @OverridingDiscouraged
130  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
131    try {
132      return this.get();
133    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
134      try {
135        return handler.apply(e);
136      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
137        r.addSuppressed(e);
138        throw r;
139      }
140    }
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}.
145   *
146   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
147   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
148   *
149   * <ul>
150   *
151   * <li><strong>It is deliberately and explicitly permitted for
152   * implementations of this method to return {@code null} for any
153   * reason.</strong> Callers of this method must be appropriately
154   * prepared.</li>
155   *
156   * <li>If an invocation of the {@link #presence()} method, on any
157   * thread, returns any of {@link Presence#ABSENT}, {@link
158   * Presence#DETERMINISTIC} or {@link Presence#PRESENT}, then an
159   * invocation of the {@link #deterministic()} method, on any thread,
160   * must return {@code true}, and additional requirements apply to
161   * the implementation of this method; see the {@link #presence()}
162   * method documentation for details.</li>
163   *
164   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic if
165   * an invocation of the {@link #presence()} method returns {@link
166   * Presence#UNKNOWN}.  (In such a case, any invocation of the {@link
167   * #deterministic()} method must return {@code false}.)</li>
168   *
169   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate the (possibly
170   * transitory) absence of a value by any of the following means:
171   *
172   * <ul>
173   *
174   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.</li>
175   *
176   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  Normally
177   * such an implementation will also return {@code true} from its
178   * {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method.</li>
179   *
180   * </ul></li>
181   *
182   * </ul>
183   *
184   * @return a value, which may be {@code null}
185   *
186   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate (usually
187   * transitory) absence
188   *
189   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate (usually
190   * permanent) absence
191   *
192   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
193   * return {@code null}, even in the normal course of events.
194   *
195   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
196   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
197   *
198   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
199   * determinism.  An ideal implementation should be idempotent.  If
200   * the {@link #deterministic() deterministic()} method returns
201   * {@code true}, then any implementation of this method must be
202   * deterministic.
203   *
204   * @see #presence()
205   *
206   * @see #deterministic()
207   */
208  @Override
209  public T get();
210
211  /**
212   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link
213   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
214   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
215   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
216   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
217   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
218   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
219   * instances that are used to indicate value absence.
220   *
221   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
222   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
223   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
224   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()} method,
225   * including {@link NoSuchElementException} and {@link
226   * UnsupportedOperationException} instances that are used to
227   * indicate value absence.</p>
228   *
229   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
230   *
231   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
232   *
233   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
234   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object) apply(Object, Object)} method on
235   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplying it with the result of an
236   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
237   * null}, or any {@link RuntimeException} that an invocation of the
238   * {@link #get()} method throws, including {@link
239   * NoSuchElementException} and {@link UnsupportedOperationException}
240   * instances that are used to indicate value absence
241   *
242   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
243   * null}
244   *
245   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
246   * return {@code null}.
247   *
248   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
249   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
250   *
251   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
252   * determinism.
253   *
254   * @see #get()
255   */
256  @OverridingDiscouraged
257  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
258    T value;
259    try {
260      value = this.get();
261    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
262      try {
263        return handler.apply(null, e);
264      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
265        r.addSuppressed(e);
266        throw r;
267      }
268    }
269    return handler.apply(value, null);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
274   * on the supplied {@code action} with the return value of an
275   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
276   * null}, unless the {@link #get()} method throws either a {@link
277   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
278   * UnsupportedOperationException}, indicating value absence, in
279   * which case no action is taken.
280   *
281   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
282   * take; must not be {@code null}
283   *
284   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
285   *
286   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
287   * determinism.
288   *
289   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
290   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
291   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
292   * accept(Object)} method may not be
293   *
294   * @see #get()
295   */
296  @Convenience
297  @OverridingDiscouraged
298  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
299    T value;
300    try {
301      value = this.get();
302    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
303      return;
304    }
305    action.accept(value);
306  }
307
308  /**
309   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object) accept(Object)} method
310   * on the supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
311   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code
312   * null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates value absence
313   * by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
314   * UnsupportedOperationException}, invokes the {@link Runnable#run()
315   * run()} method of the supplied {@code absentAction} instead.
316   *
317   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
318   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
319   *
320   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
321   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
322   *
323   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
324   * absentAction} is {@code null}
325   *
326   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
327   * determinism.
328   *
329   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
330   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
331   * supplied {@link Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)
332   * accept(Object)} method may not be and the supplied {@link
333   * Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run() run()} method may not be
334   *
335   * @see #get()
336   */
337  @Convenience
338  @OverridingDiscouraged
339  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
340    T value;
341    try {
342      value = this.get();
343    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
344      try {
345        absentAction.run();
346        return;
347      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
348        r.addSuppressed(e);
349        throw r;
350      }
351    }
352    presentAction.accept(value);
353  }
354
355  /**
356   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
357   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
358   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
359   *
360   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
361   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
362   *
363   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
364   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
365   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
366   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
367   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
368   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
369   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
370   * methods.</p>
371   *
372   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
373   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
374   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
375   *
376   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not,
377   * and its (discouraged) overrides must not, return {@code null}.
378   *
379   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is, and
380   * its (discouraged) overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by
381   * multiple threads.
382   *
383   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
384   * determinism.
385   *
386   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
387   *
388   * @see #get()
389   */
390  @Convenience
391  @OverridingDiscouraged
392  public default Optional<T> optional() {
393    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
394  }
395
396  /**
397   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
398   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
399   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
400   * result.
401   *
402   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
403   *
404   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
405   *
406   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
407   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
408   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
409   * supplied {@code handler}
410   *
411   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
412   * null}
413   *
414   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
415   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
416   *
417   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
418   * determinism.
419   *
420   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
421   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
422   *
423   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
424   *
425   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
426   */
427  @Convenience
428  @OverridingDiscouraged
429  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
430    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
431  }
432
433  /**
434   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
435   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
436   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
437   * result.
438   *
439   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
440   *
441   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
442   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
443   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
444   * with the supplied {@code handler}
445   *
446   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
447   * null}
448   *
449   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
450   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
451   *
452   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
453   * determinism.
454   *
455   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
456   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
457   *
458   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
459   *
460   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
461   */
462  @Convenience
463  @OverridingDiscouraged
464  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
465    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
466  }
467
468  /**
469   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
470   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
471   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
472   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
473   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}.
474   *
475   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
476   *
477   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
478   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
479   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
480   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the supplied
481   * alternate value, which may be {@code null}
482   *
483   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
484   * return {@code null}.
485   *
486   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
487   * determinism.
488   *
489   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
490   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
491   *
492   * @see #get()
493   */
494  @Convenience
495  @OverridingDiscouraged
496  public default T orElse(final T other) {
497    try {
498      return this.get();
499    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
500      return other;
501    }
502  }
503
504  /**
505   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
506   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
507   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
508   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
509   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
510   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}.
511   *
512   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
513   * {@code null}
514   *
515   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
516   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
517   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
518   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result
519   * of invoking the {@link #get()} method on the supplied {@link
520   * Supplier}, which may be {@code null}
521   *
522   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
523   * null}
524   *
525   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
526   * return {@code null}.
527   *
528   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
529   * determinism.
530   *
531   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
532   * msut be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but the
533   * {@link Supplier#get() get()} method of the supplied {@code supplier}
534   * may not be
535   *
536   * @see #get()
537   */
538  @Convenience
539  @OverridingDiscouraged
540  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
541    try {
542      return this.get();
543    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
544      try {
545        return supplier.get();
546      } catch (final RuntimeException r) {
547        r.addSuppressed(e);
548        throw r;
549      }
550    }
551  }
552
553  /**
554   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
555   * may be {@code null}.
556   *
557   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
558   * may be {@code null}
559   *
560   * @exception NoSuchElementException if value absence was indicated
561   * by the {@link #get()} method
562   *
563   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
564   * return {@code null}.
565   *
566   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
567   * determinism.
568   *
569   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
570   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
571   *
572   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
573   */
574  @Convenience
575  @OverridingDiscouraged
576  public default T orElseThrow() {
577    try {
578      return this.get();
579    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
580      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
581    }
582  }
583
584  /**
585   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
586   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
587   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
588   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
589   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
590   * Supplier#get() get()} method.
591   *
592   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
593   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
594   *
595   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
596   * must not be {@code null}
597   *
598   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method, which
599   * may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()} method indicates
600   * value absence by throwing either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
601   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, throws the return
602   * value of an invocation of the supplied {@link Supplier}'s {@link
603   * Supplier#get() get()} method
604   *
605   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
606   * null}
607   *
608   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link #get()} method
609   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
610   * UnsupportedOperationException}
611   *
612   * @nullability This method and its (discouraged) overrides may
613   * return {@code null}.
614   *
615   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
616   * determinism.
617   *
618   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its (discouraged)
619   * overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
620   *
621   * @see #get()
622   */
623  @Convenience
624  @OverridingDiscouraged
625  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
626    try {
627      return this.get();
628    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
629      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
630      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
631        throwable.initCause(e);
632      } else {
633        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
634      }
635      throw throwable;
636    }
637  }
638
639  /**
640   * Returns an {@link Presence} denoting the presence of values
641   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
642   * method.
643   *
644   * <p>Overrides of this method must not call {@link
645   * #deterministic()} or undefined behavior (such as an infinite
646   * loop) may result.</p>
647   *
648   * <p>Overrides of this method must be compatible with the
649   * implementation of the {@link #get()} method.  Specifically:</p>
650   *
651   * <ul>
652   *
653   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
654   * Presence#PRESENT}, then the implementation of the {@link #get()}
655   * method must never throw either a {@link NoSuchElementException}
656   * or an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, and, for any two
657   * invocations, on any thread, must return either the same object, or
658   * objects that are indistinguishable from one another and that can
659   * be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
660   *
661   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
662   * Presence#ABSENT}, then it is expected that any two invocations of
663   * the {@link #get()} method, on any thread, will each throw either
664   * a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
665   * UnsupportedOperationException}.  If an implementation of the
666   * {@link #get()} method instead returns a value, contrary to these
667   * requirements, then the value must be treated as irrelevant or
668   * undefined.</li>
669   *
670   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
671   * Presence#DETERMINISTIC}, then any two invocations of the {@link
672   * #get()} method implementation, on any thread, must either throw
673   * either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
674   * UnsupportedOperationException}, or must return either the same
675   * object, or objects that are indistinguishable from one another
676   * and that can be substituted for each other interchangeably.</li>
677   *
678   * <li>If an override of this method returns {@link
679   * Presence#UNKNOWN}, then there are no additional requirements
680   * placed upon the implementation of the {@link #get()} method
681   * besides those defined in {@linkplain #get() its existing
682   * contract}.</li>
683   *
684   * </ul>
685   *
686   * <p>Additionally, once an override of this method returns a {@link
687   * Presence} whose {@link Presence#deterministic() deterministic()}
688   * method returns {@code true}, then it must forever afterwards, for
689   * all invocations, on all possible threads, return the same {@link
690   * Presence}.</p>
691   *
692   * <p>If any of the requirements above is not met, undefined
693   * behavior may result.</p>
694   *
695   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@link
696   * Presence#UNKNOWN}.  Overrides are strongly encouraged.</p>
697   *
698   * @return an {@link Presence} denoting the presence of values
699   * returned by this {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@link #get() get()}
700   * method
701   *
702   * @nullability This method does not, and its (encouraged) overrides
703   * must not, return {@code null}.
704   *
705   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.  Its
706   * (encouraged) overrides must be idempotent.  They may not be
707   * deterministic (see above).
708   *
709   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (encouraged) overrides must
710   * be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
711   */
712  @OverridingEncouraged
713  public default Presence presence() {
714    return Presence.UNKNOWN;
715  }
716
717  /**
718   * Returns the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
719   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
720   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
721   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
722   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
723   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
724   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method.
725   *
726   * <p>Note that this means the sole element of the {@link Stream}
727   * that is returned may be {@code null}.  If this is undesirable,
728   * consider invoking {@link Optional#stream() stream()} on the
729   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method instead.</p>
730   *
731   * @return the result of invoking the {@link Stream#of(Object)}
732   * method on the return value of an invocation of the {@link #get()}
733   * method, which may be {@code null}, or, if the {@link #get()}
734   * method indicates value absence by throwing either a {@link
735   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
736   * UnsupportedOperationException}, returns the result of invoking
737   * the {@link Stream#empty()} method
738   *
739   * @nullability This method does not, and its (discouraged)
740   * overrides must not, return {@code null}.
741   *
742   * @idempotency No guarantees are made about idempotency or
743   * determinism.
744   *
745   * @threadsafety This method is, and its (discouraged) overrides
746   * must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
747   *
748   * @see #get()
749   */
750  @Convenience
751  @OverridingDiscouraged
752  public default Stream<T> stream() {
753    try {
754      return Stream.of(this.get());
755    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
756      return Stream.empty();
757    }
758  }
759
760
761  /*
762   * Static methods.
763   */
764
765
766  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
767    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
768      return null;
769    } else {
770      throw e;
771    }
772  }
773
774  /**
775   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #presence()}
776   * method will return the supplied {@link Presence} and whose {@link
777   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
778   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}.
779   *
780   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
781   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
782   *
783   * @param presence the {@link Presence} to use; must not be {@code null}
784   *
785   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier} whose {@link #get()} method
786   * will be called; must not be {@code null}
787   *
788   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #presence()}
789   * method will return the supplied {@link Presence} and whose {@link
790   * #get()} method will return the result of invoking the {@link
791   * Supplier#get()} method on the supplied {@code supplier}
792   *
793   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code presence} or {@code
794   * supplier} is {@code null}
795   *
796   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
797   *
798   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
799   *
800   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
801   * threads.
802   */
803  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Presence presence, final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
804    Objects.requireNonNull(presence);
805    Objects.requireNonNull(supplier);
806    return new OptionalSupplier<>() {
807      @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
808      public final Presence presence() {
809        return presence;
810      }
811      @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
812      public final T get() {
813        return supplier.get();
814      }
815    };
816  }
817
818  /**
819   * Invokes {@link Absent#instance()} and returns the result.
820   *
821   * @param <T> the type of the nonexistent value the returned {@link
822   * OptionalSupplier} will never {@linkplain #get() supply}
823   *
824   * @return the result of invoking {@link Absent#instance()}
825   *
826   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
827   *
828   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
829   *
830   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
831   * multiple threads.
832   *
833   * @see Absent#instance()
834   */
835  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of() {
836    return Absent.instance();
837  }
838
839  /**
840   * Returns an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
841   * {@link Supplier}.
842   *
843   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
844   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
845   *
846   * @param supplier the {@link Supplier}; may be {@code null} in
847   * which case the return value of an invocation of {@link
848   * Absent#instance()} will be returned
849   *
850   * @return an {@link OptionalSupplier} representing the supplied
851   * {@link Supplier}
852   *
853   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
854   *
855   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
856   *
857   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
858   * multiple threads.
859   */
860  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final Supplier<T> supplier) {
861    if (supplier == null) {
862      return Absent.instance();
863    } else if (supplier instanceof OptionalSupplier<T> os) {
864      return os;
865    } else if (supplier instanceof DeterministicSupplier<T> ds) {
866      return new OptionalSupplier<>() {
867        @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
868        public final Presence presence() {
869          return Presence.DETERMINISTIC;
870        }
871        @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
872        public final T get() {
873          return ds.get();
874        }
875      };
876    } else {
877      return new OptionalSupplier<>() {
878        @Override
879        public final T get() {
880          return supplier.get();
881        }
882      };
883    }
884  }
885
886  /**
887   * Returns a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #presence()}
888   * method will return {@link Presence#PRESENT} and whose {@link
889   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}.
890   *
891   * @param <T> the type of value the returned {@link
892   * OptionalSupplier} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
893   *
894   * @param value the value the new {@link OptionalSupplier} will
895   * return from its {@link #get()} method; may be {@code null}
896   *
897   * @return a new {@link OptionalSupplier} whose {@link #presence()}
898   * method will return {@link Presence#PRESENT} and whose {@link
899   * #get()} method will return the supplied {@code value}
900   *
901   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
902   *
903   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent but is deterministic.
904   *
905   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
906   * threads.
907   */
908  public static <T> OptionalSupplier<T> of(final T value) {
909    return Present.of(value);
910  }
911
912
913  /*
914   * Inner and nested classes.
915   */
916
917
918  /**
919   * A token indicating transitory or permanent presence or absence.
920   *
921   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
922   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
923   *
924   * @see #deterministic()
925   *
926   * @see OptionalSupplier#presence()
927   */
928  public static enum Presence {
929
930    /**
931     * An {@link Presence} indicating an unknown, possibly transitory,
932     * presence or absence.
933     */
934    UNKNOWN(false),
935
936    /**
937     * An {@link Presence} indicating an unknown permanent presence or
938     * absence.
939     */
940    DETERMINISTIC(true),
941
942    /**
943     * An {@link Presence} indicating permanent absence.
944     */
945    ABSENT(true),
946
947    /**
948     * An {@link Presence} indicating permanent presence.
949     */
950    PRESENT(true);
951
952    private final boolean deterministic;
953
954    private Presence(final boolean deterministic) {
955      this.deterministic = deterministic;
956    }
957
958    /**
959     * Returns {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
960     * {@link Presence} is deterministic.
961     *
962     * @return {@code true} if the presence or absence denoted by this
963     * {@link Presence} is deterministic
964     *
965     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
966     *
967     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
968     * multiple threads.
969     */
970    public final boolean deterministic() {
971      return this.deterministic;
972    }
973
974  }
975
976  /**
977   * An {@link OptionalSupplier} implementation that indicates
978   * permanent absence.
979   *
980   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
981   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
982   */
983  public static final class Absent<T> implements OptionalSupplier<T> {
984
985
986    /*
987     * Static fields.
988     */
989
990
991    private static final Absent<?> INSTANCE = new Absent<Void>();
992
993
994    /*
995     * Constructors.
996     */
997
998
999    private Absent() {
1000      super();
1001    }
1002
1003
1004    /*
1005     * Instance methods.
1006     */
1007
1008
1009    /**
1010     * Returns {@link Presence#ABSENT} when invoked.
1011     *
1012     * @return {@link Presence#ABSENT} when invoked
1013     *
1014     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1015     *
1016     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1017     *
1018     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1019     * multiple threads.
1020     */
1021    @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
1022    public final Presence presence() {
1023      return Presence.ABSENT;
1024    }
1025
1026    /**
1027     * Throws a {@link NoSuchElementException} when invoked.
1028     *
1029     * @return nothing
1030     *
1031     * @exception NoSuchElementException when invoked
1032     *
1033     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1034     *
1035     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1036     *
1037     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1038     * multiple threads.
1039     */
1040    @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
1041    public final T get() {
1042      throw new NoSuchElementException();
1043    }
1044
1045
1046    /*
1047     * Static methods.
1048     */
1049
1050
1051    /**
1052     * Returns the sole instance of this class.
1053     *
1054     * @param <T> the type of the nonexistent value the returned
1055     * {@link Absent} will never {@linkplain #get() supply}
1056     *
1057     * @return the sole instance of this class
1058     *
1059     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1060     *
1061     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1062     *
1063     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1064     * multiple threads.
1065     */
1066    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1067    public static final <T> Absent<T> instance() {
1068      return (Absent<T>)INSTANCE;
1069    }
1070
1071  }
1072
1073  /**
1074   * An {@link OptionalSupplier} implementation that supplies a fixed
1075   * value.
1076   *
1077   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1078   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1079   */
1080  public static final class Present<T> implements OptionalSupplier<T> {
1081
1082
1083    private final T value;
1084
1085
1086    /*
1087     * Constructors.
1088     */
1089
1090
1091    /**
1092     * Creates a new {@link Present} that will {@linkplain #get()
1093     * supply} the supplied value.
1094     *
1095     * @param value the value to be {@linkplain #get() supplied}; may
1096     * be {@code null}
1097     */
1098    private Present(final T value) {
1099      super();
1100      this.value = value;
1101    }
1102
1103
1104    /*
1105     * Instance methods.
1106     */
1107
1108
1109    /**
1110     * Returns {@link Presence#PRESENT} when invoked.
1111     *
1112     * @return {@link Presence#PRESENT} when invoked
1113     *
1114     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1115     *
1116     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1117     *
1118     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1119     * multiple threads.
1120     */
1121    @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
1122    public final Presence presence() {
1123      return Presence.PRESENT;
1124    }
1125
1126    /**
1127     * Returns the value supplied {@linkplain #Present(Object) at
1128     * construction time}, which may be {@code null}.
1129     *
1130     * @return the value supplied {@linkplain #Present(Object) at
1131     * construction time}
1132     *
1133     * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
1134     *
1135     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1136     *
1137     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1138     * multiple threads.
1139     */
1140    @Override // OptionalSupplier<T>
1141    public final T get() {
1142      return this.value;
1143    }
1144
1145
1146    /*
1147     * Static methods.
1148     */
1149
1150
1151    /**
1152     * Returns a {@link Present} {@linkplain #get() supplying} the
1153     * supplied value.
1154     *
1155     * @param <T> the type of the value the returned
1156     * {@link Present} will {@linkplain #get() supply}
1157     *
1158     * @param value the value the {@link #get()} method will return;
1159     * may be {@code null}
1160     *
1161     * @return a {@link Present} {@linkplain #get() supplying} the
1162     * supplied value
1163     *
1164     * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1165     *
1166     * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1167     *
1168     * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by
1169     * multiple threads.
1170     */
1171    public static final <T> Present<T> of(final T value) {
1172      return new Present<>(value);
1173    }
1174
1175  }
1176
1177}
